definition: a plain/ping, unit of area equal to approx. 3.3058 square meters (used in Japan and Taiwan)

sentences.english: Three helipads are on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 大厦顶部有三个直升机停机坪。

sentences.english: There were three jumbos on the concrete apron.
sentences.chinese: 水泥停机坪上有三架巨型飞机。

sentences.english: Twelve enemy transport aircraft on the handstand were knocked out by mortar shells.
sentences.chinese: 停机坪上的十二架敌方运输机被迫击炮弹击毁了。

sentences.english: Army that stands guard is face to outside and seems not to have a bit of suspects.
sentences.chinese: 站岗的军卫仍面朝停机坪外面，看来一点怀疑也没有。

sentences.english: A delegation from AIESEC visits the airport apron.
sentences.chinese: AIESEC代表团参观机场停机坪。

sentences.english: The mosaic pattern on an owl butterfly egg looks like a landing pad.
sentences.chinese: 猫头鹰蝶卵上嵌花式图案看上去好像停机坪。

sentences.english: A helipad leads directly to the suite and a security guard's room in the hallway.
sentences.chinese: 套房和直升机停机坪和走廊上的保安室直接连通。

sentences.english: The ritziest hotel in Muscat offers a helicopter landing pad out back.
sentences.chinese: 马斯喀特最豪华的酒店后面提供一个直升机停机坪。

sentences.english: However because of fuel shortages, some aircraft are clogging up the tarmac.
sentences.chinese: 然而因为燃料紧缺，许多飞机阻塞了停机坪。

sentences.english: Hundreds of fans crowded onto the airfield to wait for the famous film atar.
sentences.chinese: 上百名影迷拥在停机坪上等待著名的影星。

sentences.english: After Bush deplaned, he was greeted by an honor guard on the tarmac.
sentences.chinese: 布什下飞机后，在停机坪受到仪仗队的欢迎。

sentences.english: A fighter plane is revving up on the hanger apron.
sentences.chinese: 飞机库前面停机坪上，一架战斗机正在起动。

sentences.english: The apron design also includes polyester boning.
sentences.chinese: 停机坪的设计还包括聚酯剔骨。

sentences.english: No tarmac delays, no screaming babies.
sentences.chinese: 没有停机坪延误，没有哭喊的婴孩儿。

definition: see 直升機|直升机[zhi2 sheng1 ji1]
(of aircraft) to take off and land
gangway/ramp (to board a ship or plane)
